meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tree-like in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The arborescence of the coral reef was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The arborescence of the family tree showed generations of ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The arborescence of the spaghetti on my plate made it look like a tiny forest.
meanings.sent4: The arborescence of the lightning strikes across the sky was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The arborescence of the veins in the leaf made it look like a miniature tree.

meanings.definition: A branching pattern resembling that of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The arborescence of cracks on the wall looked like a tree in winter.
meanings.sent2: The arborescence of the river delta was a beautiful sight from above.
meanings.sent3: The arborescence of the tangled wires resembled a chaotic tree in the city.
meanings.sent4: The arborescence of the roads on the map created a network like tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The arborescence of the lightning bolts in the storm painted the sky like a tree in a storm.
